page.title: 19Bramdean Village Hall
page.content: The village hall was built in 1965 with money raised by villagers and a grant from the Ministry of Education. It was built on the site of the old village school. It is let for private functions and also used for national and local elections, foot clinic and village clubs, e.g. youth club, Women's Institute, Bramdean Society, over 60's club and bingo. It is used by the church for the harvest supper and various fundraising events, as there is no separate church hall. It is run by a committee consisting not only of the trustees but also representatives of every organisation which uses the hall on a regular basis. It is run as a charity, with rents for use, and various fundraising events such as discos, barbecues and car boot sales held each year, providing income for the upkeep.
